Home - Realize Bradenton Bringing People Together in Bradenton Florida Skip to content About Team Board Press Bradenton Public Market Our Vendors Schedule Market Newsletter Event/Programs BAM!Fest Music in the Park Winter Wonderland Start-Up Circle Calendar Support Donate Our Sponsors RB Newsletter About Team Board Press Bradenton Public Market Our Vendors Schedule Market Newsletter Event/Programs BAM!Fest Music in the Park Winter Wonderland Start-Up Circle Calendar Support Donate Our Sponsors RB Newsletter Donate About Bradenton Public Market Events/Programs Support Home About Bradenton Public Market Events/Programs Support Home About Bradenton Public Market Events/Programs Support Home About Bradenton Public Market Events/Programs Support Home BAM!Fest BAM!Fest (Bradenton Art & Music Festival) transforms the Riverwalk into a dynamic, diverse, immersive art and music experience from bridge to bridge! Stay tuned for updates for BAM!Fest 2026. Bradenton Public Market Since 1979, the community has gathered on Saturdays on Old Main Street in Bradenton, Florida for the Market to enjoy fresh produce, local art, upbeat music, and each other. Support local farmers, artisans, and food producers at this free, outdoor, family-friendly event. The Market is held on Saturdays, October through May, from 9 am to 2 pm, on Old Main Street in downtown Bradenton. Music in the Park Music in the Park is a free, family-friendly music series featuring local musicians. These outdoor concerts are held on Fridays in the spring at the Bradenton Riverwalk Pavilion. The 2026 spring concerts will be held Fridays, April 11 – May 2 from 6 – 8 pm at the Bradenton Riverwalk Pavilion. Winter Wonderland Winter Wonderland is a magical seasonal celebration on Bradenton’s Old Main Street with fun for the entire family. Enjoy performances from local students, local vendors, and Santa! 2025 Winter Wonderland will be held Saturday, December 6th from 5 – 8 pm on Old Main Street, Bradenton. About Realize Bradenton Realize Bradenton is a Florida nonprofit that enhance the vibrancy of downtown Bradenton through community engagement, events, and the pursuit of insightful and innovative practices to increase social connectivity. Learn more about us . We ❤️ Our Sponsors Investors that support Realize Bradenton demonstrate their confidence in our impact and outstanding results. These businesses and individual donors are recognized as civic leaders and receive exceptional exposure within the community. Become A Sponsor P.O. About - Realize Bradenton Skip to content About Team Board Press Bradenton Public Market Our Vendors Schedule Market Newsletter Event/Programs BAM!Fest Music in the Park Winter Wonderland Start-Up Circle Calendar Support Donate Our Sponsors RB Newsletter About Team Board Press Bradenton Public Market Our Vendors Schedule Market Newsletter Event/Programs BAM!Fest Music in the Park Winter Wonderland Start-Up Circle Calendar Support Donate Our Sponsors RB Newsletter Donate About Bradenton Public Market Events/Programs Support Home About Bradenton Public Market Events/Programs Support Home About Bradenton Public Market Events/Programs Support Home About Bradenton Public Market Events/Programs Support Home About Home » About Our Mission We enhance the vibrancy of downtown Bradenton through community engagement, events, and the pursuit of insightful and innovative practices to increase social connectivity. The Team We work hard to make a difference in our community every day, and strive to be great at what we do (while having fun at the same time). Heartfelt appreciation to sponsors, donors, volunteers, and partners, because they make our work possible. Meet our team . The Board Our board members apply multi-generations of experience, knowledge, tenacity, and dedication. We are also passionate about the Bradenton area and its future. Meet our Board members . Our History Realize Bradenton was founded in 2010 to implement elements from Bradenton’s 2009 Cultural Master Plan. Since its founding, Realize Bradenton’s accomplishments include: collecting community input for the development of the Riverwalk Park and the recent Riverwalk East expansion, growing the Bradenton Farmers’ Market (now known as the Bradenton Market ), creating the Bradenton Blues Festival, increasing public art, and the recent addition of the Start-Up Circle entrepreneur program. Winter Wonderland Winter Wonderland transforms Bradenton’s Old Main Street into a seasonal celebration with fun for the entire family. Enjoy performances from local students, local vendors, and Santa. Join us on Saturday, December 14th from 5:00 – 8:30 pm on Old Main Street in Bradenton. Music in the Park Music in the Park is a free, family-friendly music series featuring local musicians. These outdoor concerts are held on Fridays in October and April at the Bradenton Riverwalk Pavilion. Start-Up Circle The Start-Up Circle is a free business and project planning course designed for aspiring and newly established entrepreneurs. Classes are taught by local experts and cover the basics of starting or bolstering an independent business – from licensing to financial literacy, market research to cash flow and more. Submit An Event Do you have an event that you would like to add to the calendar? Please submit it to our partner organization, Discover Bradenton, for consideration. Splash | About Us Blog Contact Newsletter Signup f t Our Work Why Project WISE Water Sanitation Hygiene Menstrual Health Partners About Us Core Values Meet the Team Meet the Board Financials 501c3 Letter Careers Social Enterprises Where Nepal China India Ethiopia Cambodia Bangladesh Thailand Vietnam Impact Stories Our Impact Donate Donate Give Monthly: The Tap Give Annually: The Fountain Other Ways to Give Get Involved Blog Contact Newsletter Signup We clean water for kids. Splash is a social justice organization committed to the poor, an international development agency disciplined around urban economies, a social enterprise dedicated to putting ourselves out of business, and a safe water company focused on children. Put this odd combination together and exciting things are happening. Core Values We shift, we grow, we stumble, we pivot and we continually refine our work and scope—yet amidst the ever-moving landscape of international development, there are core values that act as constants for Splash. People People first. People second. People third. Quality Beautiful products that function and last. Honesty No drama, no surprises, no BS. Joy Kids at heart, seeing potential everywhere. Mistakes Make them, don’t repeat them. Meet the Team The Splash Team is international. We hire fun folks who continually impress us with their smarts, ingenuity and tenacity. We're collegial. We're rigorous. We work hard, play hard, and dream big. Really, really big. Addisu ShewaMoltot WASH Promotion & Partnership Manager Addis Ababa, Ethiopia Anna Lin Mitchell Chief Finance and Administration Officer Manchester-by-the-Sea, MA Bellen Moges Menstrual Health Program Manager Addis Ababa, Ethiopia Cameron Schupp Director, Development Operations & Donor Relations Washington, D.C. Carole Wanjau Executive Director - Africa Johnannesburg, South Africa Chris Nicoletti Chief Impact Officer Fort Collins, CO Christine Nyagode Regional Director, Finance & Operations Nairobi, Kenya Cudjoe Bennett Chief Program Officer Washington, D.C. Current Openings Meet the Board The Splash Board of Directors holds Splash accountable, verifies progress, collaborates on strategy, maintains standards, ensures quality, and works tirelessly on behalf of clean water for kids.
